nl.tue.geometrycore.algorithms.dsp

Class DijkstrasShortestPath<TGraph extends SimpleGraph<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>,TGeom extends OrientedGeometry<TGeom>,TVertex extends SimpleVertex<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>,TEdge extends SimpleEdge<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.algorithms.dsp.DijkstrasShortestPath<TGraph,TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>
  • Type Parameters:
    TGraph - Class of graph to be used for shortest-path computations
    TGeom - Class of edge geometry used by TGraph
    TVertex - Class of vertex used by TGraph
    TEdge - Class of edge used by TGraph

    public class DijkstrasShortestPath<TGraph extends SimpleGraph<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>,TGeom extends OrientedGeometry<TGeom>,TVertex extends SimpleVertex<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>,TEdge extends SimpleEdge<TGeom,TVertex,TEdge>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm, running in O(V log V + E) time. Note that an instance of this class assumes the vertices of the graph do not change. If the graph is changed, create a fresh instance for new shortest-paths queries.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DijkstrasShortestPath(TGraph graph)
      Creates a object that can be queried for shortest paths in the given graph.
      DijkstrasShortestPath(TGraph graph, EdgeWeightInterface<TEdge> weights)
      Creates a object that can be queried for shortest paths in the given graph.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<TEdge> computeShortestDetour(TEdge edge)
      Computes the shortest path between the endpoints of the given edge, without using the edge provided, and returns this path as a list of edges.
      double computeShortestDetourLength(TEdge edge)
      Computes the shortest path between the endpoints of the given edge, without using the edge provided, and returns its length.
      java.util.List<TEdge> computeShortestPath(TVertex from, TVertex to)
      Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns this path as a list of edges.
      Pair<java.util.List<TEdge>,java.lang.Double> computeShortestPathAndLength(TVertex from, TVertex to)
      Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns this path as a list of edges as well as the computed length.
      double computeShortestPathLength(TVertex from, TVertex to)
      Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns its length.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DijkstrasShortestPath

        public DijkstrasShortestPath(TGraph graph)
        Creates a object that can be queried for shortest paths in the given graph. It uses length-weighted edges. Note that an instance of this class assumes that the vertices of the graph do not change.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph in which to compute shortest paths

      • DijkstrasShortestPath

        public DijkstrasShortestPath(TGraph graph,
                             EdgeWeightInterface<TEdge> weights)
        Creates a object that can be queried for shortest paths in the given graph. Note that an instance of this class assumes the vertices of the graph do not change.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph in which to compute shortest paths
        weights - interface that specifies custom edge weights for the computation

    • Method Detail

      • computeShortestPathAndLength

        public Pair<java.util.List<TEdge>,java.lang.Double> computeShortestPathAndLength(TVertex from,
                                                                                 TVertex to)
        Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns this path as a list of edges as well as the computed length. Note that the orientation of the edges need not correspond to the orientation required to make a consistent path. Null is returned if no path exists.
        Parameters:
        from - first node in the desired path
        to - last node in the desired path
        Returns:
        null if no path was found, or a pair containing the path in a list of edges as well as its computed length

      • computeShortestPath

        public java.util.List<TEdge> computeShortestPath(TVertex from,
                                                 TVertex to)
        Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns this path as a list of edges. Note that the orientation of the edges need not correspond to the orientation required to make a consistent path. Null is returned if no path exists.
        Parameters:
        from - first node in the desired path
        to - last node in the desired path
        Returns:
        list of edges representing the shortest path or null

      • computeShortestPathLength

        public double computeShortestPathLength(TVertex from,
                                        TVertex to)
        Computes the shortest path between the given vertices and returns its length. Positive infinity is returned if no path exists.
        Parameters:
        from - first node in the desired path
        to - last node in the desired path
        Returns:
        length of the shortest path or positive infinity

      • computeShortestDetour

        public java.util.List<TEdge> computeShortestDetour(TEdge edge)
        Computes the shortest path between the endpoints of the given edge, without using the edge provided, and returns this path as a list of edges. Note that the orientation of the edges need not correspond to the orientation required to make a consistent path. Null is returned if no path exists.
        Parameters:
        edge - edge to find the shortest alternative path for
        Returns:
        list of edges representing the shortest detour or null

      • computeShortestDetourLength

        public double computeShortestDetourLength(TEdge edge)
        Computes the shortest path between the endpoints of the given edge, without using the edge provided, and returns its length. Positive infinity is returned if no path exists.
        Parameters:
        edge - edge to find the shortest alternative path for
        Returns:
        length of the shortest detour or positive infinity
